dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will and Eddie race out laughing. Bev is waiting on the c to meet them. She flips Will the stolen goods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not bad for a bunch of amateurs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She flashes a pack of STOLEN CIGARETTES and struts off towards her house. THEY LOVE THIS GIRL. Will closes Eddie mouth and they hustle round the corner into RICHARD'S ALL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He flips Ben his medicine. Stan runs up from behind, stil looking blanched from his synogogue experience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit Stan, what happened to you? You look like you've seen a ghost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees Ben there, looking like a train wreck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON A CLOSE-UP of the "Coen shoe" placed on a desk i front of CHIEF BORTON and OFFICER BOWERS, Travis' hillbil father. Will is alone in the room with them while--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben, all bandaged up, looks on with Eddie, Richie, and St as Will speaks to the police officers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beverly was there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she stole this stuff for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley wants Ben to shut up, but Ben is beyond excited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did she know it was for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think she even knows you're alive man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes she does.                   What's going on in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think? He's handing `em the kid's shoe. It's riveting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben checks his Timex, cracked but working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Takes a lickin' and keeps on tickin', huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mom gave it to me so I wouldn't be late for curfew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he means you, Big Ben.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys shove him playfully.   Ben shoves back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's funny, `til the last week I didn't think anyone knew my name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're pretty friggin' hard to miss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys, you think whoever kidnapped Dorsey might of, I dunno... got Georgie too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he creeps in storm drains,    Who's Georgie? maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will's little brother. Or was. Before your time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will won't talk about it but the kid's arm got ripped clean off in a flash flood or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richie turns towards Stan, who's been unnaturally quiet t whole time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat got your tongue?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you so quiet?            What's Chief Borton goin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not.   I'm listening.        A storm drain. Crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will steps out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did he say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Thanked me for being a good young citizen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So let's get outta here. Police stations always make me feel guilty of something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The five losers bike home, Will and Eddie, Stan and Ben riding double. Will skids up to a chain link fence by the rail yards. Eddie jumping off to take his usual short cut They all splinter off their different ways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barrens? Don't fag out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fag you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will lays out on the carpet in front of the TV, eating ic cream from a carton. His parents sit on opposite ends of couch like bookends, father flips through a Popular Mechanics. His mom stares at the TV, her mind elsewhere. There seems to be no connection between any of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found something today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response. Finally his Mom stirs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You say something honey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That missing Coen boy. I found a clue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His parents flash looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay out of it, Will. Let the police handle these things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They go back to watching TV. Will tries for some sort of connection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Arcadia?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His dad stops mid flip, all the air going out of the room

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We haven't talked about our park trip at the end of the summer. Usually by now we're all looking at the brochure together. We have so much fun there every--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will's dad throws the magazine down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He storms out to his workshop. Sharon is too upset to loo her son in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did I say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing... Your father, it's just too much to deal with right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll mow lawns. Paint fences. Whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She loses it for a moment, then composes herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your brother just looked forward to this trip so much. That park was his favorite place in the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes Will's carton and retreats into the kitchen. Wi is left all alone, TV blaring, spoon hanging over nothing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mine too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A slummy apartment over Lower Main Street. A Red Sox game blares on from somewhere down the hall. We track down the hallway and PAN just as Beverly starts to unzip her pants close the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beverly finishes peeing. She reaches for toilet paper but there isn't any. She rifles through the toiletries under old fashioned sink basin looking for anything she can use

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beverly looks around for the voice, startled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me, Beverly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It comes from THE SINK DRAIN, above her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands, her pants still around her ankles, leaning forward over the basin, looking down into the dark void.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is s-someone there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. BEV'S EYE PEERS DOWN THROUGH THE CIRCLE OF LIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all want to meet you, Beverly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gasps, backpedaling, pulling up her pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The single voice turns into a cacophony, bubbling up thro the ages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Matthew... I'm Dorsey... I'm Veronica... I'm Georgie... Come play with us down here... Come play with the clown... You'll float, Beverly. Oh how you'll float...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrified, Beverly dashes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bev finds HER FATHER (40s) asleep in front of the TV, sti in his janitor's uniform from Derry Home Hospital. His toolbelt is thrown up on the coffee table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tip-toes over and steals the TAPE MEASURER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beverly stands over the sink basin, tape measurer in hand The voice is silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She unfurls the tape into the drain, its tip disappearing into the void.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOOT BY FOOT she snakes the tape into the drain, until it fully extended at 20 feet. She waits for a voice. Nothing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly, she begins to reel the tape back in, counting dow the length as it winds back in. 16 feet... 15 feet... 14 feet... AT 13 FEET VISCOUS BLOOD COATS THE TAPE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEVERLY GASPS and drops the measurer. It goes clattering the sink, the tape coiling up like a snake, blood flicker everywhere as she stumbles back, tripping into the shower

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a demonic ejaculation -- blood splatters the mirror, wallpaper, bouncing off walls and covering Beverly. She SCREAMS and runs out the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...into her father, who comes charging up the hall. She screams again, recoiling away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the devil's gotten into you, girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bathroom! Daddy, in the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His arm shoots out and GRABS HER WRIST LIKE A VICE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone peeking at you, Bevvie? Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... the sink... in the sink...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stalks past, dragging her behind him. They step into..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Marsh looks around, eyes wide, blood splattered everywhere, but the blood doesn't register with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shoves her against the wall. Hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I hate gettin' rough with you. I never do when you don't deserve it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points back to the gory sink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's my tape measurer doin' outta my toolbelt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps over and grabs the BLOOD-COATED TAPE, clipping i onto his belt, blood on his hands now too. He doesn't see to see any of it. Only Beverly can. She realizes this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Answer me girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He raises his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sink... I was... I thought I saw a spider...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncertain whether he'll hit her anyway, she closes her ey and prepares for a smacking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A spider?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. I'm sorry for waking you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lowers his hand, gentle now, proprietary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I worry about you, Bevvie. I worry a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smoothing out her hair over her forehead. The blood on he face like finger paint. This is when he scares her the mo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know why I don't drink or smoke or chase after women like other fathers do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you love momma?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not just her, Bevvie. You. You're almost a woman now, too. And I got me all I need right here at home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rests his forehead against hers, breathes in her scent goes back down the hall to his game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON a wet, dark spot as it grows on a white plaster ceiling, the first droplet of water forming. SLOW MOTION it breaks away and falls through space...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...onto Will's head. He doesn't stir. But then it is followed by SEVERAL OTHERS. Finally, he awakes. Looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A leak in the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will flips back his covers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will grabs a bucket from a utility closet and, walking ba sees Georgie's room's door open...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will enters, the room frozen in time. GEORGIE'S TOY BOX i open. Photographs and posters line the walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STAR WARS bedsheets crisp and military tight on the bed. Lego Turtle on the night stand. Will picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will sits down, Turtle in hand, and indulges in the sadne that has engulfed his home for months. The loss of his brother hitting him full force, he closes his eyes to fig back the tears, but cannot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He cries for George. Photographs of George, illuminated b passing cars, seem to watch him from the walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SHADOW seems to stretch across Georgie's room from the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will looks up but no one is there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will steps out of George's room and finds DARK FOOTPRINTS THE CARPET. He leans down and touches one -- squishy and wet. They track down the dark staircase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will, heart pounding, follows the wet footprints down the stairs, careful not to step in any of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?   Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the bottom of the stairs Will finds the footprints lea TOWARD THE KITCHEN WHERE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will sees a YELLOW FLASH of something ducking around the corner. Startled, Will drops the Lego turtle, which smash into pieces and scatters across the wood floor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will looks back up the stairs half-expecting his parents wake up. Nothing but an eerie silence. He gathers his cou and follows the wet footprints into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will steps in, face to face with THE CELLAR DOOR, the doo creaking closed, light snapped on behind it, footprints disappearing down into the cellar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Georgie?

dialogues.speaker: WILL RESPONDS WITH HIS OWN "CODE" CALL. THERE IS NO
dialogues.text: IMMEDIATE RESPONSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will slowly approaches the door and reaches out for the handle, but stops with second thoughts. He starts backing away, too spooked to go down, when he hears...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CHILD WEEPING BEYOND THE DOOR, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will opens the door, rickety stairs leading down into darkness, the weeper somewhere in the recesses, along wit the steady sound of a LEAK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steeling himself, Will descends. He gets to the last few rungs and is thrown off for a moment seeing HIS REFLECTIO the basement floor, as if it were A BLACK MIRROR. He real

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will looks up toward the leak/weeping sound and sees, cur in the same corner where we had that opening POV...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rain rolling off him like he's still in a storm flooding cellar. He looks up at Will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you make me go, Willy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Georgie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will moves to step into the water when he hesitates, hold his foot over it. He looks to Georgie whose expression of distress seems insincere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me, Willy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will grabs a rake from the wall and pokes its tip into th water. It's a good six inches deep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll float.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water and muck pour from his mouth as he says these last words, an endless cascade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will recoils. Georgie glides over the water towards Will, we realize there is a creature beyond it, the colors of a clown's costume, PENNYWISE, propping up Georgie's body li MEAT PUPPET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horrified, Will races up the stairs as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PENNYWISE crosses the flooded basement and scuffles up th steps after Will, arms and legs splayed out like a chargi crocodile, Georgie's limp corpse strapped to his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will slams the door on Pennywise's/Georgie's gross face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will slams the door of his room and hides in his bed. Panting. The DOOR KNOB starts to rattle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drip. Will looks up. The leak from the ceiling getting worse. The DOOR KNOB rattles even more. Shaking until it seems like its going to fall off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. Will approaches the door. He grabs a baseball ba and prepares to attack. Swinging open the door, ready to swing... it's his FATHER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seeing the bat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy! What's wrong? What's all the noise about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will exhales, safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a leak in my ceiling. Then I went to check the cellar and its

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack looks at Will's ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the leak, son?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will points at it but nothing registers for Zach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will and Zach stand over the stairwell. Zach turns the li on and walks down, much to Will's horror, into a puddle o water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dry as a bone, Will.   Sure it wasn't just a dream?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will holds himself, too freaked out to speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will, Stan, Richie, Ben and Eddie stand at the edge of a police cordon. Beyond, CHIEF BORTON and A LINE OF POLICE OFFICERS, SHERIFF'S DEPUTIES and VOLUNTEERS sweep the woo with blood hounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we got a project we're working on out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barren's will be off limits for now, kids. Go on into town and play there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all look on in disappointment.   Then pick up their and head back into town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dog picks up a scent near A MORLOCK HOLE -- a cement cylinder that sticks about four feet out of the ground wi vented iron manhole cover stamped: DERRY SEWER DEPARTMENT drone comes from somewhere deep within.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer Butch Bowers arrives with news for Chief Borton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got another one, Chief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kid gone missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear Lord.     Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of my son's friends. Patrick Hockstettler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN OVER to reveal Travis, waiting meekly inside Officer Bowers' squad car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The family notified you directly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer Bowers nods for Travis to approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I did a little investigating of my own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him what you told me, boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travis doesn't know where to start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him, damn it! Tell him who you last saw him with. (he turns to Chief Borton) The negro boy from outside of town. The ones who run the abatoir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEN'S HAIKU is propped on a night stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beverly stirs awake. Her sheets and pillows are smeared w blood. Her face crusted with dried gore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Groggy, and nearly sleep walking, she sits up and walks o without taking stock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bev opens the door, wiping her eyes she approximates the sink, bends over to wash her face and eyes. With the firs crust of blood removed from her eyelids, she looks into t mirror and let's out a choked, exhaling GASP of horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surrounded by brown and crusty wallpaper, is Beverly's realization that the blood was not a dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beverly's Mom appears in the doorway.   Beverly turns to speechless, in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darling, sometimes I look at myself in the morning and think the same thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beverly tiptoes out of the horror scene. She shyly looks her mother as she dries her hair over a blood-drenched si oblivious to it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at these roots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beverly is speechless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puddles of BLOOD seem to lap like small waves towards us. PAN UP to reveal Mike and Leroy sweeping the blood and wa out of the slaughtering pen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer Bowers followed by SEVERAL POLICE OFFICERS enter facility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leroy Hanlon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leroy turns and notices the officers for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to bring in your boy for questioning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike turns to his father, frightened, shaking his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need a lawyer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at Mike, searching for any indication what this could be about. Travis appears in the distance and Mike instantly knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, it's-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer Bowers roughly grabs Mike by the neck and starts lead him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go, boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!   No need for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs Officer Bowers by the arm. Bowers quickly and excessively puts Leroy in a wrist lock and throttles him against the killing pen fence. Leroy moans in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Search this place, now. It's the perfect place to hide a body if you ever needed to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer Bowers looks around in disgust.   Travis smiles f the safety of distance and local power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This ain't right! You need a warrant, you can't just-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leroy seizes his arm, then his chest, then crumples to th ground, losing consciousness in the puddle of blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike tries to rush for him but he is forcefully escorted waiting police car. Other Officers look to Bowers for direction. Officer Bowers turns Leroy over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call an ambulance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALL of the boys have gathered in Ben's room. An aimless summer morning with nothing to do. They play with his jun and are generally turning his room over. Will examines a pair of walkie-talkies not unlike his own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, what's with the history project, Benny-boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richie notices that Ben's walls are covered in xerox copi and historical drawings, all relating to Derry's history.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, uh, when I first moved here I didn't have anyone to play with or anything, so I just started hanging out in the Library.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of the boys turn and look at Ben.   Seriously?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you, the "Reading      He's a regular Jordy Lafo Rainbow"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan takes a closer look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is it all, like, people getting killed and missing kids and stuff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. There's just a lot of that here. Been that way since the original settlers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will, who was more interested in a Viewmaster, turns and looks at the walls now. Sees a copy of an old-timey docum with 300 signatures. INCORPORATION OF THE TOWNSHIP OF DER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a copy of the Town Charter. Seriously?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derry started as a logging camp before it was officially on any maps. 300 people signed the charter that made Derry Derry. A month later they all disappeared, without a trace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire town?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie is freaked out by this revelation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The people, the livestock, everything that was alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus.                          Holy fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you supposed to be Jewish?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan thumps Richie in the stomach while still paying attention to Ben.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People in neighboring settlements thought it was Indians or something but there was no sign of an attack. The only clue was a well house that was burnt down to charcoal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, maybe we could get Derry on Unsolved Mysteries!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben points out on an old map that has a translucent moder map drawn by hand laid over it, his tracing coordinates-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was here. Right on the corner of what's now Witcham and Jackson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, isn't that where Will's brother, Georgie-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richie slaps Eddie in the back of the head. His fierce ey castigating Eddie for not thinking before speaking, Eddie confused, "wha-?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's where Georgie died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.    I didn't-              (to Eddie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about it. Why do you have all this stuff anyway? I mean. What are you going to do with it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will can't take his eyes off all of the information.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. It was just a way to kill time, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's summer, dorkus. If you're gonna kill time, do it right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will, Richie, Eddie, Stan, and Ben, stripped to their tig whities (except Ben who still has a T-shirt), stand in a staring at the edge of a rocky outcropping in a quarry tu pond. The black water of the pond foreboding, endless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screw that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben, with those cuts you have on your chest, I'm not sure if getting in this water-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you stop with the grey water shit. You make it seem like any water we get in is like swimming in an out-house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's grey water?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get him started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys turn around to see Bev in a one piece summer dre She pulls off the dress quickly, down to her underwear, sprints off the edge and jumps into the water. BOOM. Cannonball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys, not wanting to be showed up by the girl take on last look at each other and jump in. SPLASH! SPLASH! SPLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All except for Eddie, who crawls down the rock outcroppin and stares at the screaming and laughing kids enviously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you waiting for? Why don't you get in you pussy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie dips the toes of one of his feet in.   Flabbergaste Richie gives up on motivating Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richie dives under the water and swims beneath the kickin legs of all his friends, a shark's P.O.V. He doesn't see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PENNYWISE floating in from the depths beneath him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the surface Ben yelps, something yanking his leg. Rich surfaces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very funny, Richie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something yanks Richie's leg too. Hard. He and Ben wait f whoever it was to surface from the inky water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben sees Will, Bev, and Stan swimming back toward Eddie o the edge of the quarry. They scream and laugh and swim th asses back to land.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SIX of them now sunbathe on the rocks at the edge of pond. Their eyes are closed, soaking in the vitamin D, except Ben, who can't take his off of Beverly's tanning b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will sits up and looks out at the water. It is so black i seems other worldly. Not breaking his stare from the wate he addresses the group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you guys ever feel there's something wrong with Derry. Like it's, I don't know, haunted or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haunted how?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I keep thinking about Ben's walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben, happy to have something else to focus on other than Beverly, looks at Will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean how all sorts of disasters and disappearances and stuff keeps on happening here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   It's strange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan opens his eyes and joins in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like any town, right? That's been around long enough, bad stuff is bound to happen. I mean, have you read the Torah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richie, turns over to work on his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boys, you're ruining my sunbathing vibes with all this chitter chatter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beverly, eyes still closed, places a cigarette in her mou and lights up. Ben notices her hands shake as she holds t cigarette in her mouth. The smoke swirls and dissipates o them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you been seeing "things" Will?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will whips his neck to Beverly. He can't tell if she is making fun or if she is seriously asking him for a bridge

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... If I tell you guys something you won't think I'm crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We already know you're crazy, Will. No judgement here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw Georgie last night.   Only. It wasn't him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like.   In your dreams?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. In my house, he tried to get me to go into the basement with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That wasn't Georgie, that was your neighborhood sex offender making a house call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up Richie. It wasn't just him. I saw this other... I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you see Will?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clown?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will, Stan and Eddie look at Ben.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. That's what it was, a scary looking clown. And it had these teeth...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw something, too. In the basement of the synogogue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I take it back. I'm judging all of you and you are all friggin' wackos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beverly, still laying there, exhales a long trail of smok

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to show you guys something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FIVE boys and Beverly stand outside her slummy apartm building. She looks frightened to go inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Daddy will kill me if he finds out I had boys in our apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't he at work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes he comes home for a nap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should leave lookouts. Ben, Stan, can you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben is ready to protest. Then succumbs, crestfallen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does he look like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Daddy?    Mean. Like a drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will, Richie and Eddie go with Bev.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bev opens the door. It creeks open. The apartment seems t be empty. Afternoon sunlight illuminating floating dust motes. She scouts around and lets them in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will, Richie, and Eddie follow her to a closed door at th end of the hallway -- THE BATHROOM DOOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you give me an indicator of what I'm about to walk into?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope it's Ed McMahon and I've just won publishers clearing house 10 million dollar sweepstakes. But if it is, you really didn't have to go through so much trouble, you could have just brought Ed to the quarry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has no intention of going in. Will pushes past Richie opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God. Oh God.  THE BLOOD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still there, faded into maroon clouds on the mirror and wallpaper. Richie reels back into the hallway with Beverl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks from Richie to Will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really see it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like someone slaughtered a pig in here. Or a parent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richie is slack jawed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bev is so relieved she almost cries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sink. It came out from the sink. My parents couldn't see it. I thought I was going crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will goes to Eddie, who still stands frozen in terror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay, Eddie? Eddie Kaspbrack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie snaps to it, suddenly more composed, resolute even.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed. Go outside. Get Ben and send him in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie just nods and walks out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see it, don't you, Richie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richie nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't leave it like this.    Let's clean it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will, Richie, Ben and Bev clean like grim elves, using a bucket of hot water, ajax, and some cloth rags. Slowly th blood washes out. Reaching for the same rag, Will and Bev hands touch, a spark between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan and Eddie stand lookout on a curb below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's taking them so long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was a lot of blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie shakes his head. Something disturbing catches his attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will pours the last of pink bucket water down the bathtub drain. The bathroom now as clean as it ever was. The buck is filled with blood stained rags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I'm saying is maybe there's some weirdo going around Derry dressed as a clown. You know, like the Joker in a "Dark Knight" comic. Some whack job who likes to dress up and kidnap kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, so how did he put Georgie in my basement?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or blood in my sink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Who knows how crazy people do things, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pebbles hit the window. Richie goes over, sees Eddie and jumping up and down. The sound of footsteps come up the hallway. They look at each other, who's the extra footste

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Marsh fumbles with his keys outside the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They race through the apartment to a window that opens to fire escape into the alley. Bev throws it open and Will, Bev, and Richie climb through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am now.    Thanks to you guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The window slams shut behind them just as Mr. Marsh enter the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees a bloody rag on the counter and picks it up, wipi his sweaty face, smearing blood all over it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief Borton and Officer Bowers hand Mike's mom a copy of Mike's signed statement. He nearly has to defend himself from her anger.  CHIEF BORTON                     MIKE'S MOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma'am. Ma'am.                     His father is in the ho (BEAT)                         in critical condition and Ma'am!                            you, you're supposed to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma'am. We were just doing our job, but he's free to go home with you, now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He damn well better be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer Bowers leans into Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got lucky, boy. Could have been you who disappeared. Be careful next time creeping around old places like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you who chased me there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike nods to TRAVIS BOWERS, who is sitting, shamefully, i office next door to Chief Borton's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, and he will be punished, don't you worry, I swear on my belt buckle he will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer Bowers smiles, looks at Travis, whose face reveal knows he will get a whooping that night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Mikey. Your father needs us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike turns and follows his Mom obediently out of Chief Borton's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On their way out, Mike and his Mom pass Will, Ben, Bev, S Eddie and Richie scrambling in the door to the station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened, homeschool?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike says nothing, his eyes looking forward in anger. Wil and the others rush toward Chief Borton's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blocking the way) Whoa whoa. Where do you crumb snatchers think you're going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know what's been taking the kids. Chief!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borton steps out.    His long day just got worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, Butch. Someone try to do something to you kids?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not someone.    Something.        There's like this spiri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A clown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or sometimes it's something else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only us kids can see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borton narrows his eyes at Richie, the only one silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, stop. Is this you Tozier? Did you put them up to this little practical joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we all saw it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Such wild imaginations. Too bad we can't bottle their little brains. Dry them out and grind them into powder to salt our food. Maybe then we'd see, what was it again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borton's exhausted.   He's having none of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You youngsters realize there's a penalty in Derry for filing a false police report. I don't want to have to call your parents, now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we're not lying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have any evidence?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids all look at each other, stymied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I thought. I don't want to hear another word of this, not here, not a whisper of it anywhere. Now go home, all of you. Eat dinner with your families, sleep and have sweet dreams in your pj's. And tomorrow, you're going to go play like normal kids and forget all about this fantasy about murder and monsters. This is an adult matter. You got it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you adults aren't doing anything!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch your tone, boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids all stand there, Borton's big frame intimidating

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see you leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids all step outside, morally deflated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess we're on our own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TITLE CARD over the PENOBSCOT RIVER:    JULY 4th, 1988

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A smoky haze obscures the setting sun and rough hewed mountains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRRRRRACK! A mailbox explodes as a Trans-Am speeds off, t boys inside it whooping and laughing their heads off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car swings up to another and Travis Bowers leans out the window, throwing in a SIZZLING M-80.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shuts the lid, pulls back into the passenger seat, and screams to the driver, Victor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go! Go! Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor hits it and they roar off. Snatch and MOOSE SADLER (16) scrunched like sardines in the backseat. They all lo back to see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRRRRRACK! The mailbox explodes. The boys share a hip fla bottle of Southern Comfort-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God I love the Fourth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my turn. Pass one back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travis fishes the bag full of M-80s and bottle rockets an they blow another mailbox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike enters, sheepish. Leroy is in bed, full of tubes to bleeping machines. He looks decimated. Mike's mom is on h way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike nods.    She squeezes Mike's shoulder as she goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom tell you what's the what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctors say it's inside your bones. And spreading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Mom's going to need you to be strong, Mikey. Help keep the abatoir running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do or you don't do. No try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leroy coughs.    His lungs are filling with fluid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop that, Mike. There's no one to blame here. It's nature taking its course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're coming home though, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leroy looks at his son, sadness etched in the lines of hi sullen face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull up that seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leroy indicates a chair next to the bed. Mike pulls it up and sits next to his Dad, leaning in close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something I never told nobody. Not even your mom. Something that I think you should know in case...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In case of what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He coughs again. Mike can smell the creeping death coming from his father's insides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was about your age. Me and my buddies would go to this place along the canal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOUNG LEROY (13) and YOUNG DICK (13) sneak up along the r of the canal outside a raucous, crowded little gin joint. Only black folks stand in line to get in, music and rever blaring from within. The two boys look at all the pretty girls and snazzy men with awe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, I'm responsible. You don't need to tell me some long tale about drinking and driving or safe sex. I'll take care of things-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leroy squeezes Mike's arm, frustrated.   Harder than he thought he could squeeze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm. Not. Done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leroy groans through his teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't about you, Mike. It's not even about me. It's about Derry. This town is like poison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He coughs again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up    and listen to me. There was one    night, 1960. I remember because    it was August and Chubby Checker    just dropped "the twist".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hot hot night, the little shack filled up to the rafter with people dancing, twisting, enjoying themselves. YOUNG LEROY and YOUNG DICK push their way through the sweaty bo to a window. They find some floaters on the sill there an drink them up. Out the window Leroy notices...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stalk from the woods and light torches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men in white robes -- THE MAINE LEGION OF DECENCY -- barricade the door with a cart and light the timbers on f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smoke starts to take over the place. People panic, stampe the doors. They don't budge. Women, men are crushed again the hot door as people push against them to get out. Youn Leroy among them. He's grabbed by his friend Dick who pus him out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick and Leroy go stumbling and coughing away from the blazing shack, their eyes burning with smoke, blinded. Th trip over the edge into the dark waters of the CANAL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He seems to float off into a reverie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worse thing I ever seen. And the smell, that awful smell -- all cooked flesh. Somehow we ended up in the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Floating in the blackness, I could still hear all them screams. It wasn't until I surfaced that I could see the truth of it all. Of Derry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What truth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw something, Mikey. Through the smoke and the burning. Something I can't even really explain, but it was there, Dickie saw it, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A NURSE walks in with a chemo bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Hanlon, you ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Leroy lock eyes. Leroy leans in, whispers so the nurse can't hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw what was really responsible for that fire, Mikey. Not the Legion. See those white boys, they were there, but there was something else, orchestrating `em. Had `em all in a fit and frenzy, moved to his whims. This thing, I don't even know how to describe it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A balloon surfaces from the waters, bringing with it PENNYWISE. It pulls him over to a survivor swimming in darkness and Pennywise pounces, dragging the victim under water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leroy and Dick see this and are horrified. They begin swimming back to the edge when a balloon surfaces nearby, again pulling Pennywise, his face smeared with blood, fro the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It drags the clown toward them. They climb out of the can just as Pennywise gets within striking distance. Instead pounces on a woman there, dragging her under kicking and screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the shore Leroy rests in Dick's arms, the Black Spot n just a heap of smoldering char, the grounds littered with burned up bodies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike looks at his father, terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Hanlon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he grabs Mike's shirt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be careful out there son. Especially by the canal. The water in Derry is no place for no one, especially a youngster like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nurse hooks up the chemo bag to Leroy's IV. She turns towards Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You might want to wait outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike hesitantly leaves the room as she pricks the needle his dad's catheter, Leroy wincing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike steps out into the corridor. The hospital seems eeri dark, empty and quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LIGHT STROBES down the long hall. It draws Mike to it, a moth to a flame. He turns the corner and sees...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fire alarm pulled, white greasy fingerprints on the lev Emergency lights strobe along the walls. No sound of an alarm. No doctors or nurses anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, at the end of the long corridor, a SHEEP trots from a door, staccato in the strobing light. It stops, lo at Mike, then trots into another door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike starts after it, baffled. He approaches the door the sheep walked into, a stream of WATER FLOODING OUT ONTO TH FLOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops, the water rushing past his feet. He looks back behind him, the normally lit hallway now far far away.  BAAA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hears the sheep just inside the open door. He enters through it without noticing the stencil on the glass of t door: "DERRY COUNTY CORONER."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike enters a windowless bunker like room with all the me corpse lockers, metal autopsy table and a sink in the cor the emergency lights still strobing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sheep is nowhere to be found.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instead Mike finds, in the middle of the floor under the autopsy table, a DRAIN GURGLING UP WATER, the source of t flooding out into the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door slams behind him. Mike runs over to it, jiggles lock, but it won't open. Behind him, in between flashes o the strobe, PENNYWISE APPEARS THEN DISAPPEARS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike stops dead, sensing It's presence like he did at the Ironworks. He slowly looks back as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike opens his mouth to scream but nothing comes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's pounding on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody! HELP! Let me out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad! Mom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks over his shoulder while continuing to BANG. The tray inside the open locker slowly slides out, like a ton from a mocking black mouth. On it, under a white sheet, i CORPSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike dares look back just as the sheet catches and the co is uncovered. It's none other than PATRICK HOCKSTETTLER, whose legs and arms (up to the elbow) have been bit off, smaller, CHILD SIZE bite marks cover his body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie!
