dialogues.text: Eddie, coming back to consciousness, looks around the roo He moans in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the hole above, Will and Ben appear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Realizing he is alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We tried, we can't get down stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean you can't get down stairs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie looks around the creepy room at the sheets.   Somet horrible could be under any one of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you see anything you could use to climb out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I- I think I broke my arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds it up and the lower part of his arm hangs irregularly. Behind him the old refrigerator SHAKES, SOMETHING INSIDE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's 15 feet sheer drop above the dilapidated pier.    Ri is too scared to jump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, Richie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta a better idea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass breaks and CROWS STORM OUT OF A WINDOW behind them. Startled, they all lose their footing and fall, crashing onto a pile of rope below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie looks to the shaking fridge. Blood oozes out of it starts to cover the floor, inching towards him. Eddie bac away, horrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No no no. Will?     Help me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will sees the blood, looks to Ben and Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't leave him alone down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike looks at the old moldy mattress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie hops onto a rocking chair as the whole floor is coa with BLOOD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry, guys!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fridge door starts to YAWN OPEN. Eddie curls in a bal and closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't happening. This isn't happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside is Pennywise, all curled up. He unfurls himself li a coiled snake, holding a balloon on a string. It drags h floating just above the bloody floor, across the room tow Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open your eyes Eddie-bear. I brought you some cracker-jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go away!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Away? But I just got here? And we're gonna have soooooo much fun, you and me. Now open those peepers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kee-mon Eddie Bear. Don'cha wanna see the show? You're the main event.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie does. Pennywise is over him now, his teeth like raz his clawed hands reaching out for Eddie's neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all taste soooooooo much better when you're afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie screeeeeeeeeams!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike lifts up the mattress and sees a decomposed corpse o some child underneath it. He screams, falling backwards towards Will and Ben.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fall onto Pennywise, smacking into the floor, blood splattering the walls, impact cushioned by Pennywise's bo They instantly fall to the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will, Mike and Ben look over to see what broke their fall just as startled Pennywise, writhing in anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie scurries away from Pennywise, who bares his fangs a Will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then the board from the window rips off to Richie, S and Beverly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She fires a bottle rocket at Pennywise's face, exploding right into his eye. The clown reels back howling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richie and Ben jump in and grab Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pennywise pulls the rocket out of his burned socket and growls at the boys, morphing into an ORANGE GAS that shoo back into the fridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie, Ben and Richie climb to safety through the window, while Will watches from the window frame Pennywise's esca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids BANG on Mrs. Kaspbrak's door. She opens it, sees broken arm and freaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Kaspbrak is placing Eddie in the front seat of their family car. He is delirious with pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You! You all did this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slams the door shut, hurting Eddie on the inside.   T kids are all too spooked to talk coherently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how delicate he is!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were attacked, Mrs. K. Travis

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it! Just stop it! If it weren't for you boys and that little tramp they'd have nothing against my Eddie-bear... Ohh, where are my keys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's nearly in tears searching her purse. She dumps it o on the ground, prescription bottles, used kleenex's, food deflated balloons. Gets on her knees and picks through it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie's done with you kids, you hear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets up when she finds the car key, speaking with suc vitriolic focus, she seems possessed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't come around here again, you don't deserve him. You're reckless, churlish little boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is why your little brother died, William, because you are a LOSER, a reckless reckless reckless loser. God help me if I were one of your parents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets in the car and screeches away towards the hospit They ALL watch the car disappear down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that went well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys, I hate to pile on bad news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben noses up to the window, Mrs. Kaspbrack's TV set flash in the dark. They all nose up, see what Ben sees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE LOCAL NEWS: Chief Borton and Officer Bowers pose i front of camera with THE ONE-ARMED OLD MAN in the U.S.S. Indianapolis hat in handcuffs. Caption under them reads:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That can't be true.   We just saw "IT."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike just shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is all crazy.    Who are you guys anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only losers in town-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who know what's going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to the club, kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They half-heartedly pat Mike on the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tilt down to the OVERHEAD shot of what we expect to be "D 1988", but instead we see forests, logging trails, a hardscrabble 19th century downtown, and a LOG CABIN SALOO squatting on the edge of the swollen Kenduskeag canal. Sm billows from its chimney, day drawing down to a misty dar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow from behind, a MAN in a lumberjack's jacket walkin through the muddy, waterlogged street, a double-bited ax slung over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WOMAN pleads with the Sheriff on the side of the street

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't run away, sir! He's just a child, missing now for more than three days!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sees the MAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you seen my baby, Claude? He's been gone near...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claude ignores the woman...  CHRYON:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And walks into the saloon, "SILVER DOLLAR" carved deep an poorly into the wood over the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dozens of loggers are bellied up at the bar, drinking bee spitting chew on the sawdust covered floor. The man with ax, CLAUDE HEROUX, elbows himself a place at the bar and throws down a TWO DOLLAR BILL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bartender brings Heroux a schooner of beer, one hardboiled egg in a bowl, a shaker of salt and some chang Heroux salts the egg and the beer, his piercing eyes stuc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He devours the egg, downs the beer, then lets out a belch The man next to him gives a friendly nod. Heroux doesn't respond. He kicks back from the bar, dragging his ax behi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroux walks past a piano being played, whispers somethin into the players ear, then throws the change from his mea $1.85 -- onto the piano top. The piano player tips his ha and changes tune to something more festive, manic almost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroux continues into the back, walking like a man in a h dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the table, EL KATOOK deals out a hand to a group of railroad bulls -- TINKER MCCUTCHEON, FLOYD CALDERWOOD, "STUGLEY" GRENIER, and EDDIE KING, a bearded man whose spectacles are almost as fat as his gut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sitting in Claude?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Floyd reaches out to grab his hand when...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroux's ax falls, chopping of Floyd's hand at the wrist. Floyd recoils back shrieking, blood spurting from the stu his severed hand remaining on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the bar somebody calls for more beer. The bartender ta a casual look back just in time to see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroux bury his ax in Tinker McCutchoen's head. The big m tries to get up, blood pouring down his face, then sits b down again. A second chop finishes him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Floyd, writhing under the table, gropes for his hand on t table above it. Heroux chops his other hand off, Floyd screams even louder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laughter from the bar as patrons rub the bartender's bald head for luck. The piano playing only gets more giddy and festive, then we see who's playing it:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PENNYWISE, fingers dancing across the keys like a virtuos

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroux turns to Ed Katook, who struggles to pull his clut pistol from its shoulder holster. He slings the ax sidewa just as Katook gets the pistol out, burying it in his bac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shot goes off. But at the bar, conversation between two loggers turns to the weather. This winter will be a jeeze

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fat Eddie King falls to the floor trying to crab away fro the table. Heroux, bloody ax dragging on the floor, comes over to the fat man who pleads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please Claude, I just got married last month.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ax comes down into Eddie's ample gut. Blood sprays al the way up to the Dollar's beamed roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Men at the bar laugh and eat their boiled eggs, dully awa of the gorefest behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroux pulls the ax out of his gut like you would a softw tree, rocking it back and forth. It finally comes free an brings it down again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie's severed head goes rolling over toward the bar, ri to the foot of a drunk, who without breaking his call for another drink, kicks it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In back, Heroux turns to the last man cowering in the cor Stugley Grenier. He takes a swing and Stugley ducks it, a splintering the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stugley scrambles into the OUTHOUSE and closes the door behind. Heroux, now totally slicked with blood, stalks ov and begins chopping his way in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He finds the windowless room empty. A sound comes from de in the pooping hole. He looks down just in time to see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stugley's boots disappear through the pool of shit and pi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroux steps out of the outhouse into the carnage of the room. Exhausted and bloody from tip to toe, he takes a se at the card table, props his ax next to him, and starts drinking what's left of the slaughtered men's beers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one in the saloon seems to pay much mind to this. No o except Pennywise at the piano, who takes great pleasure i the scene and the ditty he's playing, a greasy white smil his giddy, evil face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Loser's Club sits in front of Ben.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that is the story of the Silver Dollar Saloon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look horrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The point of telling us was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben looks at Will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's pretty obvious.      Derry's not just haunte

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like my pa was trying to warn me the night I met you guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That clown, whatever "IT" is, has been around Derry doing nasty things for a long long time. The Black Spot fire. The Bradley Gang massacre. All the way back to the first settlers who disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richie holds up a dog-eared copy of "A History of Old Der

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, man.   That         Lumberjack. FLAPJACK STORY--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatevs. It sounds like bunk to me. Didn't the guy who wrote this go insane or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. No one listened to him like no one listens to us. And unless we do something, "IT's" never going to stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, us, Will?    We're just kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hurt it at Neibolt.   That's gotta mean something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything dies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richie looks at Mike, rolls his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can kill it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay Schwarzenegger twins, simmer down. We can't even free Eddie from "mom jail" let alone take down some freaky shape-shifter with a mind- meld on all the adults of Derry. However, I do believe we could sell this story to "Tales from the crypt."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no. This is far too         I don't want to see "it" whacked for "Tales."            again. Ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think that's a choice, Stan. "IT" knows we know. We hurt it. It's going to want to hurt us back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's only a matter of time one of us is found half eaten in the Barrens. Or worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is too much for Stan. He grabs his backpack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to study for my bar-mitzvah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan goes. All the kids look to each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's just scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're all scared. That's what it feeds off of. I heard the clown tell Eddie as much. Our only defense is to stick together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah well, the only time I've been spooked is when I'm with you jokers. I'm thinking I might be safer at home. At least I know my parents won't try to kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richie goes too, leaving just the four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will enters the back door and grabs Stan's invitation for Bar-Mitzvah off the fridge:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hears fighting in the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put it back up there! Put it back now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just thought, someone else--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His mother stands in the way of his father who holds the chest of Georgie's toys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care about anyone else. I care about Georgie. I care about my little boy who's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both startle and look at Will standing there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willy, we need a minute--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? To scream at each other more?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is between your father and me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Georgie right? You, dad, and Georgie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willy, stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You stop. I hate   it. Tip toeing around you guys like   I don't exist. Like I'm the one who   died and the only one who's still   here is Ge--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His mother hits him hard. She instantly regrets it. She r down the stairs sobbing. Zach reaches out a comforting ha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you care? At least she heard me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss Georgie, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you? Because it seems like every adult in this town is blind to what's really happening, blind to what any of us kids are going through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will shoulders past his father and runs out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will sits on the curb across from the storm drain that ki Georgie. His eyes burn with anger. He stares into the dar void, half expecting Pennywise's face to appear any momen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, clown. Show your ugly face! I'll stick another firecracker in it for Georgie. Blow your whole stupid head off. Send you back to wherever a creeper like you comes from. Where are you!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He listens for a response. Nothing. Just the bubbling sou of water rushing through the sewer. Water. Something dawn on Will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will bikes up to the edge of the hulking old structure. clocks the river flowing just beyond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hundreds of black ravens, the same birds from Neibolt, wa him from perches all along the skeletal structure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will sees Bev's mom leave for work, then bikes around bac where he clocks a tangle of pipes protruding from the bac the building down into a MORLOCK HOLE marked Derry Sewer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Marsh watches Bill from the window above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will tramps down to the spot where he found the shoe. He looks back down the stream, water trickling out of the se pipe into the Barrens. The water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something watches him from inside the cylinder of the pip

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will bikes up to the mouth of the pier, the house suspend over the canal, its imploded facade seeming to gape back Will like Munch's "The Scream." Water again. In Will's mind, it all comes together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie and his mom sit on the couch and watch soaps. Eddie plays with a loose thread of his cast, twisting it in his fingers, not a friend's signature anywhere.  KRSSSST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie? Eddie you there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His walkie crackles from a high shelf over the TV. Mrs. Kaspbrack looks at her son, eyebrows raised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I took the batteries out of that thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie shakes his head, as if to say he didn't know.     S points for him to get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie? I know where to find--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs the walkie, holds it tenderly in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He complies.   BANG BANG BANG.   They both look at the do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Kaspbrak angrily swings open the door. A surprised D HANDOR, Eddie's general practitioner, is on the porch the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! Dr. Handor. You gave me a fright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She spots Will over his shoulder, straddling his bike in middle of the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They step inside.   Will pockets his Walkie and goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Handor checks Eddie's cast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you feeling, son? Any pain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   Feels fine I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kept the cast pretty clean, I see. Didn't you want any of your friends to sign it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not allowed to see them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Mom thinks they're the reason I got hurt. She says I'm sensitive and they don't take care of me like she does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Handor wants to say something, but hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She means your allergies?   Is that it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Mom says I should always carry my Epi-pen with me, in case I ever have an episode.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother knows best. Is that it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Handor smiles, considering his next thought. He leans too close for comfort for Eddie. For a moment it's creepy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie, do you know what a placebo is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bottle of Southern Comfort sits on a log. BLAM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bowers shoots at it with his dad's police issue .45. Vict and Snatch look on, giggling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He finally tags it, the bottle shattering into a thousand pieces. They all whoop and holler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I try?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches for the gun.    Bowers pushes him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Go put the next target out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travis points to the cat that's lounging there in the gra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're foolin' right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I look like I'm foolin' numb nuts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snatch grabs the kitty and runs out to the stump. He wipe away the glass and sets the cat down. It starts to meow a tries to get away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not staying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bower lines up a shot, sight of the barrel on the cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it there, butt cheese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer Bowers steps from his police cruiser in the drive His face as red as fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing, pa. Just cleaning your gun like you asked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cleaning my gun, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stalks up and grabs the gun from Travis. Smells it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAP! He smacks Travis hard in the face, knocking the big to the grass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Normally I use a rod and cleaner not bullets and whiskey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two punks put your sticky little fingers on my firearm here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor and Snatch are too scared to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: N-N-No sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch turns the gun on Travis at his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not worth the salt you lick boy. I don't know how I let you squirm your way out your momma's womb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pa, I'm---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shoots the ground around     Travis feet. Travis squea a girl, utterly terrified.      BLAM! BLAM! A large wet s spreads around his crotch.      Butch Bowers raises the p as if he were about to whip     Travis, who falls to the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the boys) Look at him now boys. Nothing like a little fear to make a paper man crumble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clean your drawers `fore you come inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He spits out his disgust, stalks inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor and Snatch tip-toe over to Travis, not knowing wha say or do. Travis does everything he can not to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay, Travis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An odd wind stirs through the grass there, a yellow menac gathering of clouds overhead. Travis suddenly notices...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BALLOON, bobbing over his mailbox, string connected to something stuffed inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travis pushes past his two cronies and goes over to the mailbox. Inside he pulls out THE KNIFE. The one he lost a the beginning. And attached to the string a note:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A murderous look screws onto Travis' face as he turns his attention to his house. And his pa inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He snaps the string and starts toward the front door with knife. The balloon floats up into the darkening sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A THUNDERCLAP outside. The coroner steps out the door. Wi and Mike slip in behind him, Will propping open the door his Walkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick was in one of the lockers. All the water bubbled up from there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The drain. Will goes to it. Gazes down into the blackness

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sewers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "IT." Whenever it shows up, there's always water around. The storm drain where Georgie died. The leak in my room. Beverly's sink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dad saw it near water, too.      The canal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll bet if you trace every terrible event in Derry you'll find the same thing. Water. With the Penobscot river on one side and Kenduskeag canal cutting through it's impossible to escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless you live way out in the sticks like I do. We have to tell the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will realizes something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, Stan's bar mitzvah.   I almost forgot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't invited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will hands him his invite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are now. Let's go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pair of YELLOW EYES glow from the drain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beverly, all gussied up in a pretty white dress, heads fo the door. A hand snatches out from behind and seizes her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you think you going girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My friend's party. I told ma--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're all prettied up. Who you all prettied up for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shoves her against the wall, eyes her little body up a down. Caresses her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't lie to me, Bevvie. You know how I worry about you. I worry a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People in town seen you. Got to sayin' things. Like how my little girl been sneakin' around all summer long with a pack of boys. Only girl to the pack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're my friends, daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He squeezes her cheeks with one hand, holding her head in place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure about that, Bevvie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I-- I swear. They're just friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Friends? I know what's in them boys minds when they look at you, Bevvie. I know all too well. They want to do bad things. Did you let them do bad things to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looms over her. Something in his manner is detached. L he's there but isn't there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a good girl daddy. Good, just like you raised me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that so? Then what's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls out Ben's Haiku Poem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had it squirreled away in your underwear drawer. Why would you want to hide it with your underwear Bevvie? What else are you holdin' out from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nothing, daddy.   Just a poem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your hair is winter fire,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My heart burns there, too

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs her by the hair and pulls her up to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds lusty to me. Who wrote it. Which one of your boyfriends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you I don't have one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't lie to me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drags her down the hall by the hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy stop. You're hurting me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're ma says you're a woman now. You bled. What other womanly things you been doing down in the deep dark woods with those boys, Bevvie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws her into his bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Please, daddy. You don't have to worry. I promise. Please!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see then. Prove to me you been good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't know what he means.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take off your tights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you Bevvie. You're special. You're such a pretty girl. But there's plenty of boys happy to roon a pretty girl. Plenty of pretty girls willing to be roont. I need to know if you're intact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He unbuckles his belt, but he doesn't look at her like he wants to whip her, there's another hunger in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your tights, girl. Take `em off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slides off his belt and grabs her, smiling, a smile th feels all too reminiscent of a clown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll like it, Bevvie.   Be like you're floating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bev kicks him in the balls. Her father lets go, crumpling down. She knees him in the face as hard as she can, his h flying back into the side of the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beverly tries to race out the door but he snatches her an and she trips into the hallway. By the time she is up he lunging towards her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stumbles back into the bathroom and shuts the door, trying to lock herself inside. He kicks the door open bef the lock catches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without thinking Bev grabs the toilet top and smashes it her dad's face. He slumps down, unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rushes out, then uses a chair propped against the kno shut him in the bathroom. Terrified she races out the fro door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie stands in front of his mom, eyes blazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Placebo? Who told you that? Dr. Handor? He has no right. No right to say you're making up your sickness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not me, momma... You.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said I was never allergic until you made me start carrying around my Epi-pen. You put those allergies in my head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a lie, Eddie! A bold faced lie. You're my treasure. The only thing I want in this world is to see you safe and healthy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why did you send my friends away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts to feel the fluttery bird of panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were bad boys. You know that. And you... You were so sick when you were little. So very sick. It hurt me so much. I never want to see you go through that again. And I've kept you healthy, haven't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lied to me mamma. You've been giving me medicine that's not really medicine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie-bear, please--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is what's going to happen now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls out his Epi-pen and throws it in the trash.   Mr Kaspbrak gasps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going out that door and you won't stop me. I'm going to my friend Stan's bar-mitzvah and when I come home you're never going to tell how weak or sick or delicate I am ever again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUNDER crackles outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will and Mike tear through the howling rain on their bike They almost collide into Beverly who comes dashing around corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bev. You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks back over her shoulder, terrified and wet and shivering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened. Bowers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   My daddy. He... he...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?   What did he do Beverly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at both of them, tears running down her face, h pretty dress soaked in the rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I don't know if it was him, or...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think "IT" was there, controlling him, I don't know, I can't go back, I can't go back, Will. I don't know

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts to cry on Will's shoulder. Will looks at Mike. They both look up at the convulsive yellow sky. SOMETHING BIG is about to happen and they both know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With torrential downpour outside, leaking water drips fro the ceiling onto the crowd below, who have cheerfully employed umbrellas indoor to deal with the nuisance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan is giving a nervous, but otherwise successful readin the Torah, despite the howling wind and end of days vibe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richie and Ben sit in the back in their little jackets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This storm is crazy.   Like the sky's gonna fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLAM! Everyone looks back towards the door, blown open by the wind, and at Eddie, who sheepishly was trying to slip

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan smiles at his friend, pleased he's out of "mom jail. The CANTOR gives him a nudge and continues reading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie slides in meekly next to Richie and Ben, checking h clip-on bowtie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through his teeth) Way to make an entry, Eddie-bear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you escape?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess I'm not as weak as I thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front door creaks open, Victor and Snatch poking thei heads in, both soaked to the bone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Bowers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. They see a streak of blood on the floor that lea to the KITCHEN and Butch Bowers on the linoleum floor in red pool, stabbed dozens of times, the knife left in his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor vomits.   The cat slips in and starts licking up t blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travis, dude, you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snatch continues on into the LIVING ROOM where he finds TRAVIS sitting in Butch's favorite Lazy-boy in front of t TV, which is turned on to PENNYWISE THE CLOWN SHOW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds the .45, All slicked in blood, his eyes glazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my gun now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and looks at Snatch and Victor in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STORM GROWLS outside. Richie, Ben and Eddie look at e other, a little on edge. Suddenly the doors crash open ag and Stan stops, once again, looking up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will, Bev, and Mike slink into the back of the synagogue, soaking wet. The Rabbi's wife shoots them a look of dagge

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reading is over and the crowd starts to gather to lea for the reception. Will, Bev, Ben, Richie, Eddie, and Mik are all huddled together. Stan is the only one not there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean your dad attacked you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was like that lumberjack Ben told us about. The one from the Silver Dollar. He had this look. Like someone was pushing him to do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not someone. "IT".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie, thinking about his mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys, if "IT" can take over Beverly's parents, why not the rest of ours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't go back there guys. He'll kill me. Or worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This sinks in to everyone. There's only one thing they ca do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will knows where to find "IT."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sewers. Me and Mike figured it out. That's how it gets around. That's where it lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa whoa whoa. You don't really

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it means protecting Beverly, count me in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beverly looks at Ben, consistently impressed by his defen of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, count you in to what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sewers. We go in. All of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And friggin do what?   In this storm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water is actively dripping on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get rid of "IT" before "IT" gets rid of us, one by one. It doesn't know what to do when all of us are together, you have to believe me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan shakes hands with his aunts and uncles near the fron door. The wind whips up the women's dresses and unhinges umbrellas. Will and the gang run to him and whisk him out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey guys.    How'd I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope your schlong grew those 12 inches cuz you're gonna need it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The storm picks up force, wind blowing umbrellas inside o and from the hands of guests trudging back to the parking lot. One goes tumbling across the gardens and into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BLACK BOILING RIVER and sinks into the dark water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will and the gang arrive like their own hurricane in the cellar workshop. Whipping around the room and picking up objects, Will unfurls a map on his dad's work table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other kids stock up on whatever armor or weapons they find -- crossbow, hockey pads, a hubcap as shield, a sledgehammer, a hockey stick shaved into a stake, satchel full of car flares, hairspray. Stan is still processing what's going on. Mixed with their formal wear for the eve they look mildly ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on. How are we-?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richie hands Stan a chainsaw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy bar mitzvah, Jason. Bet you didn't put this sucker on your gift list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone pounds at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will, what are you doing in there? Open up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone looks to Will.   He folds up the map into a back

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to protect each other Stan. The seven of us is all we have. Together "IT" can't hurt us. I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More knocking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willy, now! We need to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will steps up to Stan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have faith. Just like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan looks to the others, everyone scared but ready for battle. Stans steels himself, owning up his chainsaw. The door shakes with Zach behind it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it, Will!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will opens the back window and the kids slip out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The losers -- ALL 7 OF THEM -- stand on the threshold of Old Ironworks cellar hold, the very same one PATRICK HOCKSTETTLER died in... a yawning chasm of mud, pools of water and hulking, shattered old boilers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rain and wind howls, lightning cracking overhead. Wil points to a huge SEWER PIPE that juts out of the muck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is our only way into Derry's original sewer system before it was sealed off and modernized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bullet sparks off a iron post next to Will's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travis, Snatch and Victor stand at the crest of the road leading to the factory. Travis has his dad's gun, aimed l Dirty Harry at them. He pops off another round, BLANG-PIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will grabs Bev's hand, who grabs Ben's who grab's Eddie's on down the line. They follow Will around the cellar hold a giant conveyor belt toppled against the edge. They scal down it into the chasm, bullets pinging around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLICK CLICK CLICK. Travis runs out of ammo.     He throws gun away and pulls out the bloody knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, this is where Patrick Hockstettler went missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way I'm going down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travis glares at Snatch, PENNYWISE appearing near the boy a flash of lightning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travis lunges with the knife and plunges it into Snatch's tummy. Victor watches in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still have second thoughts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor shakes his head no. Snatch stumbles back and plung into the darkness of the cellar hold...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SMACK! Snatch's lifeless body slams into the muck right i front of Will and the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God oh my God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't look back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They dart into the blackness of the huge, rusty pipe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travis turns back to Victor, a dull craze in his eyes. gestures to the conveyor the kids climbed down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The losers follow Will, who uses his dad's map to lead th deeper and deeper into the sewers which roar and chime wi rushing water. They turn a corner and come to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stream of water seems to disappear under the stone wa there. Everyone is terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, guys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shines his light on something in the corner...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's suppose to be a tunnel here. The last tunnel that's shown on the map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a SHOE.    Eddie comes over it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorsey's other shoe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan sweeps his flashlight up the wall.   What he finds m Richie spring back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, guys!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scrawled in blood on the stones is a warning:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WORD TO THE WISE FROM PENNYWISE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pennywise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, "IT" has a name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Footsteps echo from behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep moving!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan finds a loose stone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.   Will, over here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all kick at the stones, which give way to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travis and Victor race down the tunnels after them. They turn the corner and come to the dead end, a pile of stone kicked out from a BLACK HOLE. Travis kneels down and look into it. He can see Will and the gang's FLASHLIGHTS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I seeeeeeeeeee yooooooouuuu losers!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will and the others slosh on their hands and knees down t hole, with roots and bursting through its stone ribs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It grows narrower and narrower to the point of complete a utter claustrophobia. Mike looks back past Ben and sees..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two shadowy figures crawling toward them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will, leading them, comes to a SMALL CORKSCREW in a tangl roots blocking them they all have to wrench their way aro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben, the last of the group, GETS STUCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No no no no no!   Guys!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travis bears down, his knife clenched in his teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna carve you up, tits. I'm going to stick this blade right up your asshole and split you in two. Feed your ass fat to the friggin' pigs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts squealing like a pig. Ben is freaked. Two pair hands grab Ben's arms and yank hard. He wrenches through corkscrew and stumbles out into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A thin membrane floats over gelatinous water, very delica almost skin like. Underneath, thousands of spiders swim, and writhe. He can actually feel their legs push against underside of the layer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God oh my God oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't jiggle it too much, whatever you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't want it to tear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben freezes, the spiders knowing he's there and gathering under his butt. Bev, Stan, Eddie and Mike look on from so ground on the other side of the membrane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take off your shoes. You'll be fine. Just move real real slow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben, Mike and Will take off their sneaks and crawl across membrane with great care. SPIDERS GATHER wherever they pr a knee or hand, the whole thing sloshing like a water bed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travis and Victor get to the corkscrew pass. There's no w Travis, huge compared to the other kids, will fit through

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! No no no no! Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll never fit. We've gotta go back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travis grabs Victor by the scruff of the neck. A crooked, bloodthirsty look flashes across his ugly face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to hear them squeal.   Now you'll fit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts the knife into Victor's hand and points to keep going. For a split second Victor thinks about stabbing hi but he's too scared. He squeezes his rangy frame through roots into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor flops out onto the membrane just as Ben, Will and join the others on firm ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor sees them.   He's freaked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Guys. Wait! Please! Travis has gone insane. I'm not trying to hurt you, just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now noticing the room he is in, realizing the danger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take me with you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone looks to Will, who sees something on the membran that gives him pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will is pointing. Beverly follows his eyes to the knife i Victor's hand, which has PUNCTURED THE MEMBRANE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spiders spill out onto it's surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh god oh god!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He freaks, spiders jumping on him, his motion only rippin the membrane more. It finally tears and Victor plunges beneath the membrane, spiders devouring him, Victor screa in agony as they fill his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horrified, Will and the others run for their lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travis hears the screaming, enjoying it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. That's good, Vic.      Kill `em. Kill `em all!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly spiders start spilling out from behind the roots the corkscrew. Travis screams, and kicks them away. But more come. Freaked, he retreats back to the sewer tunnels

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will, Ben, Bev, Mike, Eddie, Stan and Richie stumble from dark into a massive, soaring, subterranean Pantheon-like hall, sewer water streaming past their feet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the center of the floor is a massive OCULUS, open to w appears to be the edge of INFINITE SPACE. The water from sewers flows down into seven channels around this opening ending at...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SEVEN WATERFALLS THAT FALL UPWARDS into a reflecting pool that covers much of the ceiling, surrounding a stone isla with a CRYPT TYPE STRUCTURE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole cavern seems to be lit from within, a sickly, pulsing ambient light coming from everywhere and nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something tells me we're not in Derry anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will heads toward the edge of the oculus, where the waterfalls stream up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get too close to the edge, Will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's up there isn't it?   That's where "IT" sleeps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pointing at the reflecting pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean Pennywise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter what it calls itself. What matters is it's afraid to show us what it really is. Which means we can beat it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will sees Beverly over by one of the waterfalls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess I'm going first again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beverly, wait-!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She jumps into the waterfall and it sweeps her up up up t the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will and the boys swap holy shit looks.   Ben jumps in af her, then Will, Mike, and Stan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richie looks to Eddie, who has the same terrified look as the quarry. He holds out his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still afraid of a little grey water?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still wear diapers at night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie grabs Richie's hand and they jump into the waterfal together. They are swept up up up into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plunging into the pool with the others. For a moment they all flap and kick under water, unsure which way is up, th Bev grabs them both and pulls them to the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're upside down now, the oculus opening to space belo them, gravity seeming to work by its own rules in here..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richie looks back where they just "fell" from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mind equals blown right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera flips around and THE WORLD RIGHTS ITSELF, the oculus now above. The pool, which seemed small before, is now enormous -- like a dark, brooding lake -- the crypt island very far from them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is nothing like what it looked like from below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's in our head. All the stuff we see. It's like the allergies my mom said I had. We make it real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We do.   Or IT?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys, the island.    Let's swim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They splash toward the crypt island. Ben is the first to feel something brush past his leg. A replay of the quarry

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not funny, Richie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks back and sees no one.   Richie is a couple of le to his left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben suddenly realizes.   Bev also feels something on her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The water. There's something in the water with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly a WORMY TENTACLE extends from the water behind M Will sees it and whacks it away with his baseball bat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids hustle it freestyle across the pool for the isla

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE PULL BACK WIDE TO SEE a monstrously big, faintly outli starfish-like creature with an orange glowing eye, lurkin the depths of the reflecting pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will, then Bev, then Richie dodge a tentacle and all get the island. Stan is not far behind, with Mike, Eddie and taking the rear, swatting back more tentacles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From under Stan the ORANGE EYE APPEARS, the dark water ar him suddenly aglow. He looks down into it and it becomes clear the eye is really a mouth, and the orange is coming from deep inside its bowels -- THE DEADLIGHTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan looks directly into them and is mesmerized, so much that he stops swimming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan what are you doing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paralyzed, Stan starts to sink toward the deadlights when Mike, shielding his eyes, grabs Stan and swims him back t the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the kids give cover with their weapons -- shooting flares, swinging the sledgehammer, impaling with the stak using the hubcap as a shield -- so that Mike, helped by B and Eddie, can drag Stan onto the island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan? Stan, are you okay?       Stan!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares blankly ahead, as if his mind was wiped blank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan, it's us. You in there buddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another tentacle squirms out of the water toward them. Be shoots it with a crossbow. It goes slithering back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys. I don't think this is the best place to hang out right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley, snap out of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan blinks conscious.   He looks at them all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where am I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The worst and only bar mitzvah party you will ever have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They help Stan to his feet. Mike looks back over his shou for the monster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys, the water thing.    IT's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indeed, the reflecting pool is placid as ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will looks back to the crypt, an obsidian stone heptagon- shaped structure the size of one of Mike's killing pens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. Or just changing into something else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's using our fears against us. It wants us to be afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because we'll taste better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's supposed to rally us, Will?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to stick together, to help each other against that kind of fear you only have when you're alone. Alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all nod and follow Will onto the structure, starry d space through the oculus visible over their shoulders. Th come to a child-sized TRAP DOOR with an ancient, cosmic marking. The only way in or out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids steal themselves, weapons ready. Mike hammers a clip into the stone and ties a rope to it. Nods all aroun

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door creaks open. Nothing but pure blackness inside. Mike throws down the rope. Will looks at Bev.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will takes a breath, drops in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will shimmies down about 5 feet of rope and lights a car flare, illuminating the chamber in a blood red pall. The walls inside are rough, like the surface of a meteor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Directly under the trapdoor is a fountain like hole in th floor open to the reflecting pool. Floating on the water

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pennywise emerges from the shadows behind Will, clinging the wall, joints all turned and wrong, like a spider.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to the circus, Willy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trapdoor slams shut and slices the rope. Will falls t the floor, flare falling into the water. It dims but does go out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's near PITCH BLACK. Just Will and Pennywise. He can he his friends banging on the door, calling for him but can' see anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's scuffling all around him. Close. Will dives into the water for the flare. Rises. Sweeps it around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not afraid of you, clown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your brother wasn't afraid either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PAIR OF ORANGE EYES GLOW ABOVE HIM, IN THE DARK.   Will can't see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not until I chewed his little muscles up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will turns just in time for the eyes to recede into the black. The pounding on the trap door has stopped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhhh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will drops his bag of flares and scrambles off, tripping the hole in the floor, leg sloshing in the pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glimpses of Pennywise scuffling in the dark like a spider

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will finds a corner, the flare running out of spark. He waves it this way and that, illuminating the dark in fron him. Swinging his baseball bat wildly at shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come out from the dark then. Come out from behind that stupid mask and show me what you really are. C'mon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will looks at the last light of his flare, waiting for th end. He looks the bat in his clutch only to see it's morp into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws it away into the darkness.   The flare goes out  PITCH BLACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooooh I'd love to, Will. I'd just love to show you my deadlights. Only you wouldn't understand. And I need you to, Willy, I really really need you to understand what's going to happen to you. What it means for a little kiddie like you... to float.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A light seems to emanate from the pool underneath them, illuminating the space, illuminating...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will sees all of "IT" now. From his bare crusty feet to h bald head. His claw-like hands and his emaciated acrobat- like body. He floats just a few inches over the stone flo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will's eyes fall to the baseball bat half-way between the He lunges for it, Pennywise knocking it away. The clown seizes his neck, smiles hungrily, bares his twisted fangs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Georgie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pennywise goes for a bite and...  THWACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An arrow shoots through it's face. The injured clown reco away. Bev flops out from the reflecting pool, followed by Ben, Richie, Stan, Eddie, and Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Break into our homes, we break into yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pennywise pulls the arrow from his bloody mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charge!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike with crow bar, Stan with chainsaw, Ben with a hub ca shield and sledgehammer, Richie with his hockey stick sta Eddie with a nail gun. Will grabs his bat and joins them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pennywise tries to fend off this "Lord of the Flies" rebellion, becoming bigger, fiercer, more grotesque, but kids are too much. Just when they have "IT" bleeding and backed into a corner for the death blow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will grabs Ben's sledgehammer. The creature that looks up them isn't Pennywise but... GEORGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Willy. Please don't hurt me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not Georgie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am. I'm in here, Willy. We all are. This is the place we float.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will, it's a trick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not your fault Willy. Not you're fault I'm stuck here. But you're hurting us all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's trying to get to you, Will. Kill it. Kill it now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!   I have to think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom and dad they should know. They should know it's not your fault. I'll tell `em. I'll tell `em as long as you don't hurt us anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will is confused. This is the one thing he wanted to hear Beverly hands him his satchel with the car flares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finish him, Will. For all of us. For Georgie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will looks to the scared little boy on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm taking this fucker out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will grabs his stake away. He turns to Georgie.   Kneels down. Takes his wet little head in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I'm sorry I didn't go out there with you. I'm sorry I was sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, Willy. I know. Everything'll be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hairspray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bev sprays it through his lit flare.   Torching Georgie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!   No Willy! Please!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GEORGIE REVERTS BACK TO PENNYWISE, screaming horribly and lunging at the kids one last time. IT finally gives up, slumping to the floor dead, a black charred clownish corp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richie touches the remains and they deflates, almost as i balloon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trapdoor above them blows away, as if it were sucked by a cyclone, out of the oculus, and into what looks like stars of outer space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did we kill it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will isn't sure, he looks at the rest of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did it, Will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bev hugs him.   Ben watches, enviously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's miller ti--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the GRAVITY SPELL WEARS OFF and the kids all fal the ceiling of the stone crypt. Bev almost falls out into space, caught by Ben just in time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The water from the waterfalls and from the reflecting poo all collapse back toward the floor, along with some of th stones in the crypt around them, which begins to crumble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At first the losers hang on, afraid to fall, but eventual they lose grip and fall toward the oculus, which has begu fill up with the water from the falls and reflecting pool

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all plunge safely into the new pool below, Will's fo kicking out the bottom of it into outer space before bein pulled back by Stan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got to get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The losers hurry their way out of the sewers, storm water quickly rising around them. Will leads the way with a car flare. They come to another dead-end grate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll get out. C'mon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They continue to look for a way out, the water now up to their chests. The losers look cold, lost, and in despair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to drown down here aren't we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so cold.                      All this water. It's st

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I don't know--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're dead. So dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys, stop it. Focus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone turns to Bev. Their muse. Their light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHE TAKES Will'S FACE IN HER HANDS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One by one the kids shoot out of a STORM PIPE into the PENOBSCOT RIVER, just like Georgie's paper boat. They pop like tops, blinking owlishly against the daylight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sky is blue.   The storm has passed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will, Bev, Mike, Ben, Richie, Eddie and Stan slump soaked shivering, and exhausted on the embankment. Derry is in f view across the river, a red ball setting behind it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They gather themselves on the bank, breathing hard as the adrenaline of survival courses through their veins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now can we celebrate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan sees an OBJECT GLITTER in the sunlight. He picks it face sober and thoughtful -- an old GLASS COKE BOTTLE. He takes it by the neck, shatters it against a rock, and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will knows exactly what this means. He steps up to Stan, SLASHES Will'S PALM with the shard. One by one the others approach, Stan slashing everyone's palms, does his own la

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swear, guys. Swear if IT isn't dead, if it ever returns, we'll come back and fight it together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all clasp hands and lock eyes. A BLOOD OATH IS SWORN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travis, hair now SHOCK WHITE, expression blank and broken sits in his chair in front of white fuzz of the TV. His father's corpse is still on the floor, blood matted everywhere. POUNDING ON THE FRONT DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief Borton and other Derry cops frog march Travis out o the house in cuffs through a scene of POLICE, NEWS REPORT and a CORONER CARTING OUT A BODY BAG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike races past nurses and doctors, a swell of optimism building with every stride. He turns the corner into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leroy's bed is empty. His mom is packing up his dad's thi She looks up, tears in her eyes. Mike is devastated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we beat It.    We beat the cancer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derry.   The clown.    It.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike's mom takes him into her arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in a better place, Mikey. I know it's hard to believe. But you have to. Remember what your father always said...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leroy shows Mike a baby lamb, freshly born from its mothe womb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See son, everything has a cycle. Just when you think the world couldn't get any colder, something good always grows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike holds his mother tight, remembering, tears rolling d his cheeks. A PIANO BEGINS TO PLAY...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fur Elise. Will recognizes it as he comes up the front wa It comes from INSIDE HIS HOUSE. He races inside, hopeful, past a box of Georgie's toys left out on the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TITLE CARD:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach and Sharon Denbrough pack the last of the camping ge on top of the family Wagoneer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Load up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will stands at the curb with his gang -- Richie, Ben, Bev Eddie, Stan, and Mike. They hand him a present.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all pitched in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well Richie mostly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to mow like five hundred lawns. Stan smoked the clippings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that even mean?       You gonna open it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will does. Inside is a VINTAGE PENTAX CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear Arcadia's pretty amazing this time of year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take some pictures for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have a group hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willy c'mon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pull out of the driveway, camera on Will's lap. Zach Sharon smile back affectionately from the front seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will turns to see his friends wave bon voyage with their SCARRED HANDS. A reminder of an oath to be kept.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. WITCHAM & JACKSON STREET/SKY OVER IT - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Will drives off we RISE UP UP UP over the intersection Georgie was killed, HIGH OVER DERRY, until we come to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A floating RED BALLOON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It POPS!
